comments.text:
Created attachment 576629
lockitup.html

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:8.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0.1
Build ID: 20111120135848

Steps to reproduce:

* Navigate to http://www.ietab.net/lockitup.html (also attached)
* With that page open, enter google.com in the address bar




Actual results:

The address bar displays google.com, but we aren't actually on google.com, we're still on the lockitup.html page, thus the user has Domain A in the address bar and Domain B displaying the content.  Obviously not a good thing.



Expected results:

The page should have been closed and the tab should have been navigated to google.com.

This is done using a combination of onbeforeunload to detect the change and setInterval to navigate.  It might be possible to just do this with setInterval.

comments.text:
Sorry, I had the initial URL wrong.  Navigate to:
1) http://www.ietab.net/moztest/lockitup.html
2) Then enter www.google.com in the address bar.

Note that the address bar will say google.com, but the lockitup.html page is still displayed.

Just reproduced in Ubuntu w/Fx 3.6.17, but have also reproduced on Win7/32 with Firefox 8.0.1.

comments.text:
Confirming too, on Win XP.
Seems to be already filed.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 560767 ***

Not the same issue.  This page is redirecting in a setInterval handler, not onbeforeunload.  It just sets a value in onbeforeunload.

Fixing the other bug will not fix this one.
